reviewText: I actually bought this as A replacement set for A lost disc. NFL Films does an excellent job of capturing the drama of the Superbowl. Each dvd includes a season highlight reel that really goes in depth. The only problem I have is with the packaging. In both sets the glue that holds the place holders has dried up and caused them to fall out of the case. other than that I highly recommend the set.
Title: N/A

reviewText: What I wanted: I wanted to relive the excitement of Superbowl XXXI.  I wanted to be able to return to the astonishment of Superbowl XXXV.  I wanted to watch THE GAMES.What I saw:  I saw packaging that somply said "SUPERBOWL XXXI - XL COLLECTOR'S SET" with a Lombardi Trophy on the front.What I did NOT do:  I did not carefully read the item description.  The item description says it contains GAME FOOTAGE.  Nowhere does the description say anything about contining the games themselves.The bottom line:  These are the official NFL Productions 30 minute retrospectives about the seasons and the games, rather than the games themselves.  When this arrived I excitedly popped the first DVD in hoping to recapture Favre at his height, instead I got the grainy, muted color and monotone narration of an NFL Fils production.  I am so glad that this wasn't a Christmas present as I would feel far worse about donating it to the local library.  This doesn't even warrant collecting dust on my video shelf.  I wnated to watch the game, not hear Reggie White talk about how excited he was to play in the game, then see clips of him tackling.If anyone from the NFL is reading this: SHAME ON YOU!  Your packaging offers a tantilizing idea that we will be watching the games themselves, instead we get ... this.For me, lesson learned.
summary: A great example of why you should read descriptions carefully!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was very disappointed by this collection of broken Highlights. I was expecting something very different, not the slow motion action shots, poor camera angles, dreadful background music and slow and boring narration. Where was the big hits, the great passes and extended highlights of the games themselves. Living in Australia we only get one game of NFL shown on TV a year which is the super bowl so I was hoping to see lots of football action in real time replays with plays in chronological order. It would have been a lot more exciting for the viewer to hear the roar of the crowds and the television commentators providing colourful commentary instead of the boring dribble. The picture quality on DVD is very good however, I will say that.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First off, NFL Films is awesome! I love this series because it gives you a summary of the season leading up to the Super Bowl and then the key plays from the Super Bowl itself. These videos do not show the Super Bowl in it's entirety though so if you're looking for that you might be disappointed.
Title: N/A
